oai_dc:dc.dc:title: A pseudo-binary interdiffusion study in the beta-Ni(Pt)Al phase
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Kiruthika, Perumalsamy
Paul, Aloke
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Condensed Matter - Materials Science
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Interdiffusion study is conducted in the Ni-rich part of the beta-Ni(Pt)Al phase following the pseudo-binary approach. Interdiffusion coefficients over the whole composition range considered in this study increases with the increase in Pt content, which is in line with the theoretical study predicting the decrease in vacancy formation and migration energy because of Pt addition. The trend of change in diffusion coefficient with the increase in Ni and Pt content indicates that Pt preferably replaces Ni antisites.
